column1: Nepal King Gyanendra Wednesday evening disbanded the 205-member house of representatives at the recommendation of Prime Minister Sher Bahadur Deuba , state-run radio said .
U.S. stocks opened slightly lower as investors began to assess the market 's recent rally .
In the early exchanges , the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 19.21 to 11,307.91 .
The Standard & Poor 's 500 index was down 2.51 to 1,292.92 .
The Nasdaq composite index fell 7.28 to 2,142.26 .
Oil prices fell a fourth day after U.S. reports showed slowing economic growth .
U.S. President Bill Clinton met on Tuesday with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat at the White House for an agreement at next month 's Middle East summit .

The meeting took place after Clinton met jointly with Arafat and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday and announced they agreed to return for a summit on withdrawal of Israeli troops from the West Bank .
White House spokesman Mike McCurry said Clinton was prepared to become directly involved in the mid-October summit with Arafat and Netanyahu .
`` I think the president is determined to see an agreement arise from this exercise , '' McCurry told reporters .
